author: Special Correspondent
text:
The Indian Institute of Management Ahmedabad (IIMA) on Wednesday raised fee for its flagship two-year postgraduate programme in management from Rs. 18.5 lakh to Rs. 19.5 lakh, a cumulative fee for the entire course. The new fee structure will be applicable starting with the 2016-2018 batch.

“The IIMA Board has approved the increase of fees for its two-year PGPM. The amount is cumulative fee for both years, including tuition, academic support, accommodation, basic health care, medical insurance, and alumni association membership fee,” a release issued by the institute stated. According to the institute, the fee hike was necessitated by rising costs and high inflation. “IIMA fee increases have tended to lag inflation rate over the past several years. Taking 2009 as the base, even with the proposed increase, 2016-18 fee would be 10 % lower in inflation-adjusted terms compared to 2009-11 fee,” the release stated.
title: IIMA raises fee for flagship course
